All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractElement
Implementation of the Drawable interface associates a drawable object with a Renderer to use for drawing.
AttachedElement
An attached element is one that is associated with another "base" element such as a PlatformElement or a LiftElement.
BoundedElement
A bounded element is a Moving Element but it can only move within some bounds.
ChildElement
a child element is an element that can be associated to a parent element, and its motion is relative to the motion of the parent element
CircleRenderer
Renderer that draws a solid circle in an element's bounding rectangle.
Drawable
Interface representing minimal features of something that can be drawn on a graphics context.
ExplosionRenderer
Renderer that changes the way something is drawn over time, gradually making it fade in to the background color.
FlyingElement
Moving element in which the vertical velocity is adjusted each frame by a gravitational constant to simulate gravity.
FollowerElement
A follower element is one that is associated with another "base" element such as a PlatformElement or LiftElement.
ImageRenderer
Renderer implementation that will draw a given image within an element's bounding rectangle.
LiftElement
An element with two distinctive behaviors.
MovingElement
An element in which the update method updates the position each frame according to a velocity vector (deltaX, deltaY).
ParentElement
A parent element is a Bounded Element to which Child Elements can be associated to.
PlatformElement
A PlatformElement is an element with two distinctive behaviors.
Renderer
Interface represents a strategy for drawing a Drawable object into a given graphics context.
SimpleElement
Minimal concrete extension of AbstractElement.
SolidRenderer
Renderer that fills an element's bounding rectangle with a solid color.
VanishingElement
An element that does not move.
